article_title: Bonifay native highlights perils of health insurance gap
article_text:
By JENNIFER RICH

628-9092 | @HCTA_JenniRich

jrich@chipleypaper.com

Posted Jan. 21, 2016 at 9:22 AM

Updated Jan 21, 2016 at 9:42 AM

article_metadata.description:
MILTON — A Bonifay native knows all too well the hardship of what it’s like to be without health insurance during a catastrophic health event.
Jimi Breland, 33, was making her way in the world as a truck driver and by repairing garage doors. Breland could pay the bills, but didn’t quite make enough to afford health insurance. She was athletic in her youth and in great health until recently when an unlikely condition appeared late one night.
“We spent New Years Eve in the
article_metadata.author: JENNIFER RICH 628-9092 | @HCTA_JenniRich jrich@chipleypaper.com
